body.h1: Consensus critical limits in Bitcoin protocol and proposed block resources limit accounting

ul.a: click here to read brief discussion

hr.p: The Bitcoin protocol has various consensus critical limits, which can be categorized into script level limits and output value limits. Script level limits include restrictions on size, nOpCount, stack plus alt-stack size, and stack push size. If these limits are surpassed, they won't affect the limits of other levels. On the other hand, any single output value must be greater than or equal to zero. Additional limits could be added through a softfork by adding more metrics and always taking the maximum one.
